oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Curly Putman & Bobby Braddock Interview by John Lomax III Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Curly Putman and Bobby Braddock by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 10-26-81.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Curly Putman; Bobby Braddock;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:09) -- Curly Putman describes what creates 'depth' in a song. Curly mentions the depth of "Green, Green Grass Of Home." (1:10) -- "I think depth and simplicity, combined." - Bobby Braddock about songwriting. (2:41) -- Curly Putman speaks about the meaning of "He Stopped Loving Her Today." (5:17) -- John Lomax asks Curly Putman about the lyrics and story of "He Stopped Loving Her Today." (6:35) -- Bobby Braddock speaks about the original demo and arrangement of "He Stopped Loving Her Today." (7:35) -- Curly Putman speaks about artists turning down the record "He Stopped Loving Her Today." Johnny Russell attempted to cut it, but never put it out. (8:54) -- Curly Putman mentions that "Green, Green Grass Of Home" has been recorded five hundred times by other artists on several different albums. (10:48) -- John Lomax asks Curly Putman and Bobby Braddock about re-creating a previous photo taken together.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Putman, Curly; Braddock, Bobby;
